Title.evidence: Network Meta-Analysis of Randomised Controlled Trials for Endovascular Treatments in Superficial Femoral Artery Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: The study included 57 trials with 9089 patients.

Intervention.evidence: Randomised trials comparing endovascular interventions for SFA disease.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of various endovascular treatments for superficial femoral artery (SFA) disease.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were technical success and 12-month primary patency.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study included 57 trials with 9089 patients.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Technical success was superior for covered stent graft (CSG), bare metal stent (BMS), and atherectomy plus drug-coated balloon (A+DCB) compared with percutaneous transluminal angioplasty (PTA).
